desc: The fraction of predictions that a classification model got right.
A metric for classification models. Precision identifies the frequency with which a model was correct when predicting the positive class.
A metric for classification models that answers the following question: Out of all the possible positive labels, how many did the model correctly identify?
A type of regularization that penalizes weights in proportion to the sum of the squares of the weights.
bullets:
⭐ Drive outlier weights (high positive or low negative values) closer to 0 but not quite to 0.

⭐ Always improves generalization in linear models.
